title: NBA Daily Digest
subtitle: February 7, 2026 - Trade Deadline Fallout & Game Action!

items.headline: Anthony Davis Out for Season After Blockbuster Wizards Trade
items.summary: In a stunning turn of events following his trade from the Dallas Mavericks to the Washington Wizards, star forward Anthony Davis is expected to miss the remainder of the 2025-26 NBA season. Davis is reportedly nursing hand and groin injuries and will focus on a full recovery for the 2026-27 campaign, making his Wizards debut a distant prospect.

items.headline: Israeli Star Deni Avdija Named All-Star, But Sidelined by Back Strain
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija made history on February 2nd, becoming the first Israeli player ever selected as an NBA All-Star, earning a Western Conference reserve spot. However, the 25-year-old, who is averaging 25.5 points, 7.2 rebounds, and 6.7 assists this season, is currently sidelined with a back strain and missed Friday's game against the Grizzlies, marking his third consecutive absence.

items.headline: Bulls' Trade Deadline Haul Dented by Coby White Injury Revelation
items.summary: The Chicago Bulls' busy trade deadline saw them acquire a host of new guards and draft picks, including Jaden Ivey, Rob Dillingham, Anfernee Simons, and Collin Sexton, in a deal that sent Coby White and Nikola Vucevic elsewhere. However, a twist emerged today as one of the acquired second-round picks was reportedly rescinded after the Charlotte Hornets discovered Coby White is dealing with a left calf injury that will force him to miss time.

items.headline: Pistons Dominate Knicks, End Win Streak
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons routed the New York Knicks, ending their eight-game winning streak with a decisive victory.

items.headline: Hawks Edge Jazz in Thriller
items.summary: Atlanta secured a narrow two-point victory over Utah.

items.headline: Spurs Take Down Mavericks
items.summary: San Antonio came out on top against Dallas.

items.headline: Hornets Sting Rockets
items.summary: Charlotte defeated Houston by a ten-point margin.

items.headline: Lakers Win Close Contest Against 76ers
items.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers secured a four-point victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

items.headline: Magic Cruise Past Nets
items.summary: Orlando earned a comfortable win against Brooklyn.

items.headline: Warriors Hold Off Suns
items.summary: Golden State narrowly defeated Phoenix.

items.headline: Raptors Down Bulls
items.summary: Toronto bested Chicago in a high-scoring affair.

items.headline: Pelicans Take Down Timberwolves
items.summary: New Orleans defeated Minnesota by four points.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Dominate Grizzlies in Henderson's Debut
items.summary: Portland secured a comfortable win against Memphis, highlighted by Scoot Henderson's season debut.

items.headline: Landale Explodes in Hawks Debut!
items.summary: Jock Landale had a sensational debut for the ATL Hawks after being traded, dropping 26 PTS, 11 REB, 5 AST, and 4 BLK, including a career-high 5 three-pointers, in their win over the Jazz.

items.headline: Cunningham Leads Pistons Offense
items.summary: Cade Cunningham powered the DET Pistons with 30 PTS against the Knicks.

items.headline: Durant Drops 31 for Rockets
items.summary: Kevin Durant put up an impressive 31 PTS for the HOU Rockets in their game against the Hornets.

items.headline: Ingram Shines with 33 Points
items.summary: Brandon Ingram led the TOR Raptors with 33 PTS in their victory over the Bulls.

items.headline: Scoot Henderson Makes Season Debut
items.summary: Rookie Scoot Henderson made his season debut for the POR Trail Blazers, contributing 11 PTS and 9 AST in 21 minutes against the Grizzlies after recovering from a torn hamstring.

items.headline: NBA Trade Deadline Sees 73 Players on the Move
items.summary: The 2026 NBA trade deadline has officially passed, concluding on Friday, February 7th, with a flurry of activity. A staggering 73 players were involved in various transactions across the league. Key deals included the Cavaliers acquiring James Harden from the Clippers in exchange for Darius Garland and a second-round pick.

items.headline: Shaedon Sharpe Suffers Calf Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers guard Shaedon Sharpe exited Friday's game against the Memphis Grizzlies with a calf injury, casting uncertainty on his availability for upcoming contests.

items.headline: Star Players Sidelined: SGA, Jokic, Tatum, Haliburton, Antetokounmpo
items.summary: Several star players are currently out with injuries: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (OKC) is out until after the All-Star break, and Nikola Jokic (DEN) will not make his season debut until after the break. Additionally, Jayson Tatum (BOS), Tyrese Haliburton (IND), and Giannis Antetokounmpo (MIL) are also sidelined.

items.headline: Standings Snapshot: Pistons Lead East, Thunder Dominate West
items.summary: As of the trade deadline, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 37-13 record, while the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot in the Western Conference at 40-12.
